title: Grab the TicWatch Pro 5 for Just $140 with this Deal!
description: It's 60% cheaper than usual. The post Grab the TicWatch Pro 5 for Just $140 with this Deal! appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Mike Viray
text: If you’re on the lookout for a Wear OS smartwatch, the TicWatch Pro 5 is one of the more capable options on the market, especially when compared to competing models from more “popular” brands. It packs some impressive features which makes it a nice alternative for users after looking for a reasonably-priced and feature-packed Wear OS device. The TicWatch Pro 5 comes with a solid list of hardware, which includes a 1.43-inch AMOLED screen with Gorilla Glass, a Snapdragon W5+ Gen 1 Wearable Platform, as well as a generally-sturdy design. it also runs on Google’s Wear OS, with access to a ton of different apps from Google and third party developers. Other features include an Accelerometer, Gyro Sensor, Heart Rate Sensor, SpO2 Sensor, Skin Temperature Sensor, Low Latency Off-Body Sensor, a Barometer, and a Compass. Note: this article may contain affiliate links that help support our authors and keep the Phandroid servers running. A writer and content creator with a love for tech and music, Mike is also an avid gamer as well. He and his wife are big fans of Mario Kart. html:
If you’re on the lookout for a Wear OS smartwatch, the TicWatch Pro 5 is one of the more capable options on the market, especially when compared to competing models from more “popular” brands. It packs some impressive features which makes it a nice alternative for users after looking for a reasonably-priced and feature-packed Wear OS device.

The TicWatch Pro 5 comes with a solid list of hardware, which includes a 1.43-inch AMOLED screen with Gorilla Glass, a Snapdragon W5+ Gen 1 Wearable Platform, as well as a generally-sturdy design. it also runs on Google’s Wear OS, with access to a ton of different apps from Google and third party developers. Other features include an Accelerometer, Gyro Sensor, Heart Rate Sensor, SpO2 Sensor, Skin Temperature Sensor, Low Latency Off-Body Sensor, a Barometer, and a Compass.
